content.raw:
The realization that platforms are _sometimes_ spawning with the `ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign` command is what is puzzling me the most. I can confirm that I see this happen in the docker container but not in my host. 

Two questions:

1. What would cause any robots to spawn when running `virtual_stix.ign` with no arguments? \(maybe for @{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} - he was touching this in a recent PR\)
2. Any thoughts @{557058:6ff86fcb-b7ab-44a5-b8a6-f6d9cae8b6e8} on the relationship between these unexpectedly spawned robots and multiple clock publishers?
content.html:
The realization that platforms are sometimes spawning with the ign launch -v 4 virtual_stix.ign command is what is puzzling me the most. I can confirm that I see this happen in the docker container but not in my host.

Two questions:

  1. What would cause any robots to spawn when running virtual_stix.ign with no arguments? (maybe for @Nate Koenig - he was touching this in a recent PR)
  2. Any thoughts @Louise Poubel on the relationship between these unexpectedly spawned robots and multiple clock publishers?
